meanings.definition: To guard or watch over as a sentinel.
meanings.sent1: The soldier sentinelled the entrance to the castle.
meanings.sent2: The security guard sentinelled the museum during the night.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant cat sentinelled the backyard, keeping an eye out for any intruders.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse sentinelled the rocky coast, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The scarecrow sentinelled the cornfield, scaring away hungry birds.

meanings.sent1: The sentinelled fortress was well-protected from any threats.
meanings.sent2: The sentinelled border was closely monitored by the guards.
meanings.sent3: The sentinelled tower stood tall, overlooking the entire kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The sentinelled gates were always closed at night, ensuring security.
meanings.sent5: The sentinelled forest was a safe haven for all its inhabitants.
